posts.post_content:
Works very well with Future Sight and Sensei's Diving Top. Allows you to tutor lands to the top and be able to play up to 3 of them a turn, creating CA, and revealing the spells you actually want to cast with Future Sight.  
  
If you thought Future Sight/Top was strong on its own, just try throwing in effects that let you play extra lands each turn. ^\_-

Posted By: DacenOctavio (8/22/2011 11:25:02 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
The thing with Azusa is that she isn't a giant target like all other EDH generals, at least in my play-group.   
  
One uses [Kaalia](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Kaalia), one uses [Animar](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Animar), another uses [Verdeloth](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Verdeloth), one more uses [Niv-Mizzet](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Niv-Mizzet), and I use Azusa. Who do you think, out of those, is going to be [Chaos Warp](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Chaos Warp)ed? Not Azusa.  
  
Getting out lots of lands for a mono-green deck is just second nature. It'd be like countering [Harrow](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Harrow) or [Explosive Vegetation](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Explosive Vegetation): all you'll be doing to stirring the sh\*t around.   
  
I can say, however, that Azusa works wonders with [Rofellos, Llanowar Emissary](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Rofellos, Llanowar Emissary). Any time I have him out, the game doubles in speed for me, and thus is why he's banned as a commander.
posts.html:
The thing with Azusa is that she isn't a giant target like all other EDH generals, at least in my play-group.

One uses Kaalia, one uses Animar, another uses Verdeloth, one more uses Niv-Mizzet, and I use Azusa. Who do you think, out of those, is going to be Chaos Warped? Not Azusa.

Getting out lots of lands for a mono-green deck is just second nature. It'd be like countering Harrow or Explosive Vegetation: all you'll be doing to stirring the sh*t around.

I can say, however, that Azusa works wonders with Rofellos, Llanowar Emissary. Any time I have him out, the game doubles in speed for me, and thus is why he's banned as a commander.

posts.post_content:
One of the scariest Commanders available to ![Green](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=G&type=symbol) players. You thought [Zur, the Enchanter](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Zur, the Enchanter) was overpowered? You obviously haven't been staring down a writhing mass of Eldrazi tentacles backed by an [Overwhelming Stampede](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Overwhelming Stampede) and powered out by [Mana Reflection](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mana Reflection), [Vernal Bloom](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Vernal Bloom), and [Heartbeat of Spring](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Heartbeat of Spring). Azusa can end games faster than anything.  
If you want to give your opponents a sporting chance, how about a [Helix Pinnacle](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Helix Pinnacle)?
posts.html:
One of the scariest Commanders available to players. You thought Zur, the Enchanter was overpowered? You obviously haven't been staring down a writhing mass of Eldrazi tentacles backed by an Overwhelming Stampede and powered out by Mana Reflection, Vernal Bloom, and Heartbeat of Spring. Azusa can end games faster than anything.
If you want to give your opponents a sporting chance, how about a Helix Pinnacle?

Posted By: Trygon_Predator (5/23/2012 8:36:43 PM)

posts.post_content:
How about this:
  
   
T1: Forest, [Birds of Paradise](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Birds of Paradise)   
T2: Plains, this, another Forest and another Plains, then [Lotus Cobra](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Lotus Cobra)   
T3: [Knight of the Reliquary](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Knight of the Reliquary) (you don't have enough cards in hand to play a land and [Tideforce Elemental](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Tideforce Elemental))
  
T4: Tap all mana sources, sac a land, and get an Island.You now have 6 mana in your mana pool, so you play Tideforce Elemental and [Crucible of Worlds](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Crucible of Worlds). For the rest of the game as an instant, you can tap the Island, activate Tideforce's ability, untapping the Knight, getting you a land and an extra mana from the Cobra, continue playing 3 lands a turn from your graveyard, etc...
posts.html:
How about this:

T1: Forest, Birds of Paradise
T2: Plains, this, another Forest and another Plains, then Lotus Cobra
T3: Knight of the Reliquary (you don't have enough cards in hand to play a land and Tideforce Elemental)
T4: Tap all mana sources, sac a land, and get an Island.You now have 6 mana in your mana pool, so you play Tideforce Elemental and Crucible of Worlds. For the rest of the game as an instant, you can tap the Island, activate Tideforce's ability, untapping the Knight, getting you a land and an extra mana from the Cobra, continue playing 3 lands a turn from your graveyard, etc...
